page.title: 01MICKLEY AREA - DESCRIPTION
page.content:
Predominently rural, most of population centred in Mickley Square, West Mickley,Branch End,Stocksfield. Coal mining until closure of local pit 16 years ago. Miners transferred to Wallsend area and rehoused at West Wylam,Prudhoe. New housing estate built 11 years ago on demolished miners' back to back terraced houses brought changes in structure of population,many with professional,business and technical employment commuting to Newcastle area. North West somewhat isolated. Rest well served by public transport,rail and road. Feature of Ovington area,numerous pre- war wooden bungalows used by visitors from Newcastle and South Shields.
{Class project edited by Stanley Batey.
